intro: Navia duidae, commonly known as the Duidae's navia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. Navia duidae thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
